title: "AI As Inventor, Restaurants’ Covid Cases, Courts Go Cloud: The Morning Minute"
excerpt: "Restaurants looking to their business interruption insurance as a pandemic lifeline may have hit the end of the road. Katheryn Hayes Tucker reports that the U.S. Court of Appeals for the Eleventh Circuit recently became the latest court to deny restaurants’ argument that their insurance should cover losses stemming from shutdowns caused by COVID-19."
